intro: Antidesma spatulifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved antidesma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Indian Ocean islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often broad and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by capsule fruits. It is often found in coastal or limestone areas and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
